title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire - BBC News
summary: grenfell tower fire : people in mawsley organise donations for victims .
delapre abbey restoration spend to exceed £ 8m .

documents.title: goodbye
text: that 's the end of our live updates for northamptonshire .
we 'll be back at 08:00 on monday .
have a good weekend .

documents.title: evening forecast : overcast night
text: it 'll be a rather cloudy night with an odd spot of rain and moderate west to south westerly winds .
it 'll be mild with temperatures falling to around 15c ( 59f ) .
saturday will remain rather cloudy , with some very patchy light rain in the morning .
a few bright or sunny spells should eventually develop and there may be a few afternoon showers too .
there 'll be a mainly moderate south-westerly wind and highs around 23c ( 73f ) .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: go-ahead given for eleanor cross repairs to begin
text: work could soon start to repair one of northamptonshire 's most well-known landmarks , after historic england gave the go-ahead for the borough council to get things under way .
the eleanor cross is one of only three remaining crosses built by king edward i and has been a feature of northampton 's skyline since the 13th century .
however , the monument is in urgent need of repair and although ownership of the sculpture is shrouded in mystery , northampton borough council agreed to take responsibility .
in may it applied to historic england for permission to work on the scheduled monument on the edge of delapre abbey , near northampton , and that has now been granted .

`` scheduled monument consent has been granted for works to the monument and we are in ongoing discussions with historic england about the best way to now progress the repairs , '' a council spokesman told the bbc .
edward 's wife , queen eleanor , died near lincoln in 1290 , and the king constructed 12 crosses to mark each of the places he stopped at on his way back to london for her funeral .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: dog day afternoon
text: it 's national bring your dog to work day and police dog handlers across the uk have been showing off - because they get to do that every day !
here 's another happy handler and police pooch celebrating with a sloppy kiss .
if pc thorpe from northamptonshire police goes to work , he 's always got faithful partner pd nesi with him .
they do n't need the excuse of a gimmicky `` day '' to encourage them .
pd nesi blowing raspberries at dog handler pc thorpe @ twitterid @ twitterid # bringyourdogtoworkday # police
loving that eye contact .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

though mainly dry , there will be a few outbreaks of rain possible from time to time .
highs of 18c ( 64f )
weather has more details .

documents.title: nursing home places fall
text: the number of nursing home places in northamptonshire has fallen by more than 200 in the past three years .
it comes at a time when the number of people aged 85 or over is growing .
the figure comes from an analysis of care quality commission statistics for bbc sunday politics east .
john rayner , chair of the northamptonshire association of registered care homes , said : `` we all know that nursing homes are struggling because they are competing against nhs hospitals for staff .
international recruitment is a permanent problem . ''
councillor bill parker , who is responsible for adult social care at northamptonshire county council , said : `` there is only one care home that has closed so far this year .
`` there has not been a tremendous amount of care homes that have closed , certainly in the last six months , because of financial pressures . ''
you can see more on this on sunday politics east on bbc one this sunday at 11:00 .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: azerbaijan gp practice : verstappen goes fastest in baku
text: dutchman max verstappen led a red bull one-two in a disjointed and unrepresentative first practice session at the azerbaijan grand prix in baku .
title contenders sebastian vettel , for ferrari , and lewis hamilton , racing for brackley-based mercedes , were third and fifth , not setting times on the quickest tyre .
meanwhile , there was drama as sergio perez , of silverstone-based force india , had a sizeable accident after misjudging the tight section in the old town of baku .
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer in Baku

documents.title: video : delapre abbey restoration spend to exceed £ 8m
text: earlier this week we told you how northampton borough council had been told an extra £ 490,000 was needed to complete the restoration of delapre abbey .
the sum is on top of an extra £ 930,000 the authority approved last year and another £ 650,000 approved earlier this year .
on wednesday the council decided to allocate the extra money .
northampton has been along to delapre to speak with the borough 's leader , jonathan nunn

documents.title: grenfell tower fire : people in mawsley organise donations for victims
text: a woman from mawsley has paid tribute to the generosity of her community , after people who live there donated in their droves to a charity effort for the survivors of the grenfell tower fire .
joanna murphy put an appeal on the village 's facebook page and was inundated with donations of clothes , toys and money .
`` from the day that the fire happened , the response has been massive , '' mrs murphy told me .
`` we have decided that we are going to be in direct contact with the families via social media .
it will be an ongoing process so if clothes are too small for a child , and we have more , they will be going over .
`` we have arranged transport for that to be done . ''
any remaining donations will be sold , with all the proceeds going directly to the grenfell tower appeal , she said .
mrs murphy 's eight-year-old son ross ( above ) said he had contributed `` lego , trains and other stuff '' .
asked why he thought it was important to get involved , he added .
`` it makes me feel a bit sad that people do n't have anything else after the fire . ''
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: campaigners acquire rushden goods shed
text: rushden 's historical transport society ( rhts ) is celebrating after it was announced the group had completed the purchase of a railway shed in the town from northamptonshire county council , after years of campaigning .
the shed played a vital role in the socio-economic development of rushden at the end of the 19th century , allowing the town to expand through the boot and shoe industry .
more recently , it was used by the local highways department , before they moved to new premises in the summer of 2013 .

the transport society expressed an interest in taking the building on , but was told by the county council that a price tag of £ 500,000 would need to be met - despite the local council estimating the value of the shed at £ 250,000 .
it is not clear what financial arrangement was met between the society and the council .
in a statement on their facebook page , campaigners said they `` would like to thank east northamptonshire council and rushden town council for their support throughout the purchase process '' .
they added : `` the building is considered to be one of the largest and finest in the area .
the society and supporters felt that it was important that the site and building should be saved as part of rushden 's heritage . ''
the rhts says it intends to develop the site and building as a `` heritage community hub '' for the people of rushden and surrounding areas .

documents.title: david miller murder : accused made 'crude attempts to conceal actions '
text: the trial of four people accused of murdering a northampton man in his own home has begun today .
david miller , 56 , was found dead at his flat in boothville in june last year .
the jury at northampton crown court was told that mr miller was vulnerable and had long-standing problems with alcohol .
his body was found by police who forced entry into the flat on patterdale walk .
a post-mortem examination found he 'd been stabbed multiple times .
ian cuthbertson , 49 , michael hallett , 37 , joseph catlin , 30 , and zena kane , 35 , all of no fixed address , have gone on trial today
the prosecution said they 'd all had long periods of homelessness and used mr miller 's flat as a place to drink alcohol .
the court was told that - after his death - they 'd spent days making crude attempts at destroying his body .
they all deny murder and the trial continues .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

soon-to-be saint rob horne has been called into the @ twitterid side for their italy test on sat !
read more and you can watch live on @ twitterid if you 're up at 6am !

documents.title: cobblers play opens for public performances
text: last month we told you about a brand new theatrical experience being created at the sixfields stadium - the home to the cobblers .
well , after a handful of previews last month , the show , titled the twelth player , officially opens today .
it 's all about northampton town and tells the story of an imaginary family and their love of football , through a show which blends video , live performances and mobile app technology .
playwrights susanne thomas and sophie jump said their work was inspired by the club 's `` dark days '' in 2015 .
`` we 're trying to attract people who like football and want to come and see their stadium , '' ms thomas ( right ) told the bbc .
`` but also obviously people who normally go to the theatre maybe would like to come to see things that are not inside a theatre building .
`` a different type of theatre . ''
despite problems off the pitch , 2015-16 was a vintage season for the cobblers , who claimed the league two title with 99 points from their 46 games .
the show runs until 12 july .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: video : new attractions for irchester country park
text: last week , we told you how visitors to irchester country park can now discover the history of ironstone quarrying in the area .
it 's part of a new heritage project highlighting geological finds that date back millions of years .
the £ 120,000 initiative has been paid for by the heritage lottery fund .
the new attractions include a viewing platform , which is shaped like one of the old dragline diggers .
northampton have been to take a closer look
author: Carroll Weston
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northampton town players report for pre-season training
text: northampton town players have been getting back to business with the start of pre-season training today .
the cobblers , who yesterday found out they will start the league one season away at shrewsbury town , shared these images on their instagram account

documents.title: kings heath stabbing : boy , 17 , charged with gbh
text: a 17-year-old boy from northampton has been charged with grievous bodily harm ( gbh ) with intent after a 30-year-old man suffered multiple stab wounds in the town on tuesday .
a 31-year-old woman , who was arrested on sus of conspiracy to commit robbery in connection with the incident , has been released under investigation .
officers were called to kings heath at 04:00 after reports of a man stumbling outside an address close to the junction of mill lane and nene way .
the victim suffered multiple stab wounds to the chest , back and abdomen and was taken by paramedics to northampton general hospital , where he remains in a stable condition .

documents.title: saints pair miss out on lions squad for first test
text: neither northampton saints lock courtney lawes nor wing george north will feature for the british and irish lions in saturday 's first test against new zealand in auckland .
lawes always looked unlikely , having up a head injury 10 days ago , but he had impressed in tuesday 's match against the chiefs .
north has lost out to england 's elliot daly .
coach warren gatland has chosen ireland flanker peter o'mahony to captain the lions against the all blacks , with tour captain sam warburton on the bench .

documents.title: people asked to avoid a43 near moulton after crash
text: northamptonshire fire and rescue service is advising road users to avoid the a43 - at the roundabout for moulton and overstone - after a crash this morning .
ongoing rtc incident with 3 pumps in attendance , a43 by roundabout moulton/overstone , please avoid this area if you can .

documents.title: man injured after being shot with 'air weapon ' in desborough
text: police are appealing for witnesses after a man was shot with what they describe as an `` air weapon '' in desborough .
the 56-year-old victim suffered a minor injury to his leg in the incident , which happened while he was walking his dog on the area of grass between sycamore drive and redwood close in the town .
it happened at around 21:00 on saturday .
last week a man in northampton required treatment after being shot at with an air pistol near wellingborough road - though it is not known if the incidents are linked .
anyone with information is asked to contact the police .

documents.title: david miller murder : trial of four to begin
text: the trial of three men and a woman charged with murdering northampton man david miller will begin later .
it had been due to start yesterday , but a jury is now being sworn in today instead .
mr miller , who was 56-years-old , was found dead at his home in patterdale walk in boothville on 14 june 2016 .
ian cuthbertson , 49 , michael hallett , 37 , joseph catlin , 30 , and zena kane , 35 , all of no fixed address , are accused of murder .

text: here 's a look at what else is making the news around northamptonshire on wednesday :

documents.title: david miller murder : trial of four people delayed
text: the trial of three men and a woman charged with murdering northampton man david miller has been delayed by a day .
the 56-year-old was found dead at his home in patterdale walk in boothville on 14 june 2016 .
ian cuthbertson , 49 , michael hallett , 37 , joseph catlin , 30 , and zena kane , 35 , all of no fixed address , are accused of murder .
their trial was due to start today at northampton crown court but the jury is now expected to be sworn in tomorrow morning .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: northampton town : players to report for pre-season training tomorrow
text: the build-up to the new league one season began in earnest with the release of northampton town 's 2017-18 fixtures , earlier .
the cobblers squad return for some pre-season testing on thursday , with the squad spending two days undergoing fitness tests this week , before resuming full training on monday .
northampton town 's first pre-season friendly takes place on saturday , 8 july away to sileby rangers .
the club start their new league one season with a trip to shrewsbury town on saturday 5 , august .

documents.title: family raise thousands for life saving machine
text: a family from northamptonshire has donated £ 32,000 to the children 's charity heart link at glenfield hospital .
the money will buy an extra corporeal membrane oxygenation ( ecmo ) machine - an advanced heart and lung machine - for the hospital 's specialist congenital heart unit .
this machine helped five-year-old willow page in 2013 after she was diagnosis with an inflammation of the heart muscle caused by parainfluenza .
she suffered three heart attacks and a stroke .
her family has raised the money through skydiving , fetes , bag packing at supermarkets and birthday donations .
willow 's parents denise and iain page said : we are forever grateful to the nurses , doctors and consultants at leicester 's hospitals who helped save our beautiful little girl .
this is our way of giving something back . ''
the new ecmo machine has been officially unveiled at the hospital and has been named after willow .
two other machines , costing about £ 28,000 each , have also been funded by heart link .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: delapre abbey : a look back at its history
text: we told you about the latest on the development of delapre abbey earlier .
here 's a look back at its history :
situated just south of northampton town centre , the abbey has a long and rich heritage spanning almost 900 years .
the building , which was built by the son of simon de senlis , 2nd earl of northampton , started life as a cluniac nunnery in 1145 .
after her death in 1290 , queen eleanor 's body was taken to the abbey for the night , while en-route to westminster .
in 1940 , the war office commandeered the premises .
from 1957 to 1992 , the site was home to the northamptonshire record office .

documents.title: daventry mp to be taken 'hostage ' as part of queen 's speech tradition
text: the state opening of parliament , which takes place at 11:30 today , is a political event that is steeped in tradition and history .
the procession of black rod from the commons to the house of lords is the most well known of the day 's traditions .
but another tradition sees a government whip held `` hostage '' at the palace to ensure the queen 's safe return .
here 's a handy guide if you 're not following
the custom dates back to the civil war , when the monarch and parliament were on less cordial terms .
this year , the 'queen 's hostage ' is a northamptonshire representative , with daventry 's conservative mp chris heaton-harris taking on the role .
as this image of mr heaton-harris ' twitter profile shows , he 's out some appropriate cufflinks
brexit is expected to dominate the queen 's speech , which will cover a two-year period instead of one .
it is also expected to include measures on domestic violence and car insurance .
the conservatives are still trying to agree terms with the democratic unionists to secure their support for mrs may 's minority government .
seemingly appropriate

documents.title: northampton borough council to decide on further delapre abbey spend
text: the leader of northampton borough council says he `` does n't know '' if councillors would have started the restoration of delapre abbey if they knew its final cost .
on tuesday , we learned that councillors will decide whether to approve another £ 490,000 for the project .
it 's on top of £ 1.6m extra already approved over the last year - with the total project now costing more than £ 8m .
`` can you anticipate every cost ?
i do n't know , '' said the authority 's conservative leader jonathan nunn .
`` all i would tell you is that our attitude to spending on anything is extremely careful and cautious .
`` every penny that now remains to be spent , whether it is on car parking or whatever , there are rigorous tender processes to get the absolute best value - not necessarily the cheapest .
`` some of the new money is to bring forward planned work - but some is to meet building regulations . ''
`` i was n't involved in the initial design , '' mr nunn added .
`` there are things that would have been [ changed ] .
if they 'd been in the contract they would have been paid to the contractor , we 're now having to make sure they are done now . ''
mr nunn became leader of northampton borough council in 2016 , following the resignation of fellow conservative mary markham
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: man arrested on sus of murder over stabbing
text: we 've heard more about the arrest in connection with this morning 's stabbing in northampton .
police say the man has been arrested on sus of attempted murder , but have not revealed details of his age or where he 's from .
a man was found with stab wounds to his chest , back and abdomen in kings heath early this morning .
he remains in hospital .

documents.title: man seriously hurt in multiple stabbing
text: man seriously hurt in multiple stabbing

documents.title: man arrested over kings heath stabbings
text: a man has been arrested in connection with the stabbing incident in northampton earlier today .
shortly before 04:00 , a man with stab wounds was found outside an address on the mill lane/nene way junction in kings heath .
he has been taken to hospital , and his condition is said to be improving .
det sgt hayley thurston , who is leading the investigation , said : `` this was an extremely violent incident in which the victim suffered very serious injuries .
`` we have arrested one man in connection with the incident , but we are particularly keen to speak to a number of other people in connection with this .
`` one of them is described as a white woman , aged about 19 , with a large build .
she was about 5ft 5in to 5ft 6in with black hair that was tied back in a ponytail .
she was thought to be wearing dungarees .
`` we 're also looking for two other girls , both white and aged about 14-15 , with skinny builds and straight brown hair .
we also want to speak to a boy aged about 16 with a small , slim build and dark brown hair .
he was wearing a black top and jeans . ''
further details about the arrest are not yet known .

documents.title: 'quality support , quality win '
text: northampton saints and england lock courtney lawes has taken to instagram after helping the british and irish lions to a 34-6 win over the chiefs in new zealand

documents.title: northampton is hotter than
text: we all know that when it comes to talking about the weather , no-one does it better than the british .
the past few days have been no different , with battle lines drawn between those who say our current weather is 'too hot ' and those who simply say , 'it 's not '
this got us thinking to how the temperature in northampton compares with traditionally warmer climes .
with an expected high of 27c ( 81f ) , the county town is officially hotter than :

documents.title: more money for delapre abbey restoration
text: an extra £ 490,000 is needed to complete the restoration of delapre abbey , councillors have been told .
northampton borough council is being asked to approve the money at a meeting tomorrow for work on the building that was established as a cluniac nunnery in 1145 .
this is on top of an extra £ 930,000 the authority approved last year and another £ 650,000 approved earlier this year .
the total cost will now be more than £ 8m .
the council is keen to say the money is to bring forward the opening of some rooms and is work which falls `` outside the scope of the original contract '' .

but some of the money is to make sure that building regulations are met , and a council report says `` these are essential items and should have been included within the original scope and are necessary to deliver the original objectives . ''
whatever the reasons , the restoration bill for this building continues to rise .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: northamptonshire 's newspapers : housing plan for pub , armed forces day flag raising plans , wicksteed soapbox derby
text: here 's a look at what else is happening around northamptonshire today

documents.title: geraldine turner : missing 74-year-old woman found dead
text: yesterday we told you about a police appeal to find a missing woman from old stratford in south northamptonshire .
sadly , we 've just learned that geraldine turner , who was 74-years-old , was found dead in a field near grafton regis at about 21:00 last night .
she was last seen on foot in willow grove , old stratford , at about 06:00 yesterday .
in a statement on the force 's website , officers thanked the public for their help in sharing the appeal and to the northants search and rescue team for its assistance .
a report has been prepared for the coroner and police are not treating mrs turner 's death as sus

documents.title: police chief constable attends scene where man was stabbed 'multiple times '
text: as we 've been telling you , there has been a serious assault in northampton this morning .
police were called to the scene at the junction of mill lane and nene way in kings heath shortly before 04:00 .
earlier , northamptonshire police chief constable simon edens was spotted amongst a heavy police presence at the scene .
the victim was stabbed in the chest , back and abdomen and was taken to northampton general hospital in a `` serious '' condition .
police are searching the scene , as this video show
victim in a serious condition at northampton hospital .
suffered multiple stab wounds to chest , back and abdomen .
search under way

documents.title: police guard scene where man was stabbed 'multiple times '
text: i 'm in kings heath , northampton , where police say a man suffered `` multiple '' stab wounds in an attack at 04:00 .
there are lots of police at the scene and they are searching playing fields and a neighbouring green on nene way .
the victim of the attack suffered wounds to the chest , back and abdomen and was taken by paramedics to northampton general hospital , where his condition was described as serious .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: saints lock lawes helps british and irish lions to victory over chiefs
text: northampton saints and england lock courtney lawes has helped the british and irish lions to victory over the chiefs .
the lions won the match in hamilton , new zealand , 34-6 , with lawes ' physical approach praised by pundits .
the lions ' focus now turns to the first test against the all blacks at eden park on saturday , which kicks off at 08:35 bst .
saints ' academy coach paul diggin looks to be motioning for lawes to be involved in the match

documents.title: fire service plans go to public consultation
text: responsibility for northamptonshire 's fire service could be moved to the county 's police and crime commissioner ( pcc ) under plans unveiled today .
at present , northamptonshire county council oversees the service and its budget - which is due to be cut .
a consultation is starting which could see a new part of council tax bills to pay for the service , but the police force and the fire service would remain separate organisations .
pcc stephen mold told the bbc : `` if we increase the council tax for fire , that 's £ 1.50 a year , or three pence a week .
i think that is a price well worth paying . ''
he added : `` all of that money goes to fire .
if it stays within the county [ council ] , that money could be spent on social care and all the others .
the legislation says if you raise it for fire , it has to be spent on fire . ''
if accepted , the new arrangement would see the pcc become the police , fire and crime commissioner for the county - holding the heads of the police and fire service to account .
however , mr mold says it would not mean a restructuring at the top of the respective organisations .
`` it 's a governance change , '' he added .
`` the chief constable and chief fire officer have operational independence .
i propose the budgets , set the strategic direction in conjunction , but they have operational independence . ''
`` by bringing together [ the services ] , we can save money on buildings , maintenance .
if we maintained our fire engines , our police and ambulance - that is a specialist service for emergency maintenance that is money we can save . ''
the public consultation will run until 1 august .

documents.title: man suffers 'multiple stab wounds ' in kings heath assault
text: northamptonshire police says a man has been seriously injured after suffering `` multiple stab wounds '' in an attack in kings heath , northampton , in the early hours of this morning .
officers were called to reports of a man stumbling outside an address close to the junction of mill lane and nene way shortly before 04:00 .
the victim had suffered multiple stab wounds to the chest , back and abdomen and was taken by paramedics to northampton general hospital , where his condition is described as serious .
police are asking any one with information to contact them .

documents.title: breakingman 'seriously injured ' after stabbing in northampton
text: police say a man has been seriously injured after suffering `` multiple stab wounds '' in an alleged attack in kings heath this morning .
more to follow .

documents.title: another warm and sunny day
text: another hot , sunny and dry day across the bbc east region , but there will be a little more cloud for some parts .
inland temperatures are expected to reach between 27c and 30c ( 80f-86f ) - although it will be cooler on the coast .
tonight will be warm , with temperatures ranging between 14c and 17c ( 57f-62f ) .

documents.title: man , 58 , dies after car hits bridge
text: police are appealing for witnesses after a man died following a road traffic collision near bugbrooke this morning .
the 58-year-old man was driving from the a5 towards bugbrooke at about 07:00 when , for reasons yet unknown , his blue audi a6 left the road and hit a railway bridge , near to the wharf restaurant .
paramedics , the air ambulance and police attended the incident but the man died at the scene .

documents.title: afternoon forecast : ice cream weather
text: as expected , it 's another hot and sunny day across northamptonshire .
there is just the chance of a heavy shower later , but most places will stay dry .
the high is 29c ( 84f ) .
get the ice creams ready
weather has the forecast for where you live .

documents.title: police search for missing 74-year-old woman
text: police are appealing for help to find a missing woman from old stratford in south northamptonshire .
geraldine turner , 74 , was last seen in willow grove , old stratford , at about 06:00 this morning .
police say they are growing concerned for her welfare .
ms turner was last seen on foot , heading in the direction of deanshanger .
she was wearing blue or brown three-quarter length trousers , grey shoes and had a heavy black and white checked overcoat with her , which she may have been carrying .
anyone who sees mrs turner is asked to call northamptonshire police on 101 .

text: pilot dies after light aircraft crashes

documents.title: twenty-eight vietnamese migrants found in lorry
text: police say that 28 vietnamese migrants were found in the back of a refrigerated lorry in corby over the weekend .

they were discovered at 03:45 on saturday after the driver of a greek registered lorry delivering yoghurt to the oakley hay industrial area of corby heard banging coming from the back of his vehicle .
the migrants were given welfare checks before being detained in the cells at wellingborough .
they have now been handed over to the border agency .
the driver of the lorry has been arrested .
author: Willy Gilder
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: the green , green grass of home
text: summer pitch renovations at northampton saints ' franklin 's gardens look to be coming along nicely

documents.title: spanhoe airfield : pilot dead and passenger injured after light aircraft crash near corby
text: a pilot has died after the light aircraft he was flying crashed shortly after take-off at spanhoe airfield , near harringworth .
northamptonshire police says it happened at about 12:45 yesterday .
a passenger on board sustained serious but not life-threatening injuries and is in hospital .
the air accidents investigation branch and the police are investigating the cause of the crash .

documents.title: breakingspanhoe airfield : pilot dies after light aircraft crash
text: a pilot has died after the light aircraft he was flying crashed shortly after take-off at spanhoe airfield , near corby , on sunday , police say .
a passenger sustained serious but not life-threatening injuries .
more to follow .

text: people across northamptonshire have stopped to observe a minute 's silence for the victims of last week 's grenfell tower fire .
a silence for the 79 presumed victims of the disaster was held at 11:00 , at locations including northamptonshire police 's headquarters at wootton hall

documents.title: spanhoe airfield : light aircraft crash investigated
text: we 're looking into reports that a light aircraft crashed at spanhoe airfield , near corby , on sunday .
the air accidents investigation branch ( aaib ) , which investigates civil aircraft accidents and serious incidents within the uk , has tweeted to say :
there are no further details available at this stage .
we 've contacted both northamptonshire police and the aaib for more information .
the aaib has sent a team to investigate a light aircraft accident that occurred near spanhoe airfield , corby , northamptonshire .

documents.title: finsbury park attack : northamptonshire police to provide 'visible reassurance '
text: james andronov , the assistant chief constable of northamptonshire police , says the van attack near a london mosque will `` resonate '' with communities in northamptonshire .
one man has died and 10 people have been injured after a man drove a van into worshippers near finsbury park mosque shortly after midnight .
a 48-year-old man has been arrested on sus of attempted murder .
`` this was an horrific attack on innocent people as they walked home after prayers at their local mosque , '' mr andronov said in a statement issued on the northamptonshire force 's website .
`` this attack will resonate with many of our communities in northamptonshire who will be understandably concerned by what has happened .
`` i want them to know that our officers will be out today , and in the coming days , providing very visible reassurance .
we are already speaking to community leaders to see what more we can to do to allay any wider concerns and protect their communities from harm . ''
the incident at finsbury park is the fourth terror attack in the uk in four months , after incidents in westminster , manchester and on london bridge .
mr andronov added : `` ultimately , it is communities that defeat terrorism and we depend on information from the public , who can be our eyes and ears , in our efforts to keep us all safe . ''
police are asking any one with concerns locally to contact them on 101 .

documents.title: brexit negotiations : britain 'well placed ' for discussions , says andrea leadsom
text: britain is `` very well placed '' for brexit negotiations that start today , according to the south northamptonshire mp andrea leadsom .
michel barnier , the european commission 's chief negotiator , will sit down with brexit secretary david davis later .
the meetings will continue every four weeks until march 2019 , when britain 's membership is due to end .
`` britain has a huge amount to offer , '' mrs leadsom told me .
`` when i talk to other eu politicians , it is very much in their interests to make sure this is a successful process .
`` i think we are very well placed and the prime minister has shown her very clear determination to make a success of brexit . ''
last week mrs leadsom took on the role of leader of the house of commons and will have the job of making sure brexit legislation gets through parliament .
`` it is absolutely vital that we 're very , very clear that people understand exactly what the proposals are , and why they make sense , '' she added .
`` a big part of my job will be to make sure we take people with us and get their enthusiasm for what we 're doing . ''
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: finsbury park : northamptonshire reaction to london attack
text: the big national story is that a man has died and 10 people have been injured after a man drove a van into worshippers near a north london mosque .
the van struck people after mounting the pavement just after midnight outside muslim welfare house , near finsbury park mosque .
a 48-year-old man has been arrested .
andrea leadsom , leader of the house of commons and mp for south northamptonshire , called the incident `` senseless and evil ''
meanwhile , simon edens , the chief constable of northamptonshire police , said his thoughts were with the victims
home secretary amber rudd said police were treating the attack as a `` terrorist incident '' .
